action.action-desc: Ms. Brownley (for herself, Ms. Kuster, and Ms. Pingree) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To provide grants to reduce the amount of food waste, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Zero Food Waste Act.

paragraph.text: The Administrator shall establish and carry out a program to award competitive grants as provided in paragraph (3).
The purpose of the program established under paragraph (1) is to help reduce the amount of food waste by 50 percent by 2030, relative to such amount in 2010.

subparagraph.header: Study on food waste generation and food waste management planning
subparagraph.text: Under the program established under paragraph (1), the Administrator may award a grant to an eligible entity, excluding any eligible entity that is a nonprofit organization, to—

subclause.text: the generation of food waste in the State or area in which the eligible entity is located or otherwise serves; and
policies and programs that significantly reduce the amount of food waste, including policies and programs to carry out food waste reduction activities; and

clause.text: develop a plan under which such eligible entity will carry out at least one food waste reduction activity, prioritizing prevention to the extent practicable.

subparagraph.text: Under the program established under paragraph (1), the Administrator may award a grant to an eligible entity, excluding any eligible entity that is a nonprofit organization, to—

clause.text: collect data on the amount of food waste generated in the State or area in which the eligible entity is located or otherwise serves; and
publish, on any publicly available website (which may include the website of a nongovernmental organization), a monthly or quarterly report on the data collected under clause (i).

subparagraph.text: Under the program established under paragraph (1), the Administrator may award a grant to an eligible entity to—

subclause.text: carry out or otherwise support a food waste reduction activity;
implement a differential pricing policy on the disposal of food waste to—

item.text: disincentivize disposing of food waste by incineration or deposit in a landfill; and
incentivize carrying out food waste reduction activities;

subclause.text: pay for or provide technical assistance to carry out a food waste reduction activity;
implement restrictions on disposing of food waste by incineration or deposit in a landfill;
implement food waste reduction activity requirements;
implement demand-stimulating policies for recycling end-markets; or
carry out any other activity the Administrator determines will reduce the amount of food waste in the applicable area; and

clause.text: collect data and publish reports as described in subparagraph (B).

paragraph.text: To apply for a grant under this section, an eligible entity shall submit to the Administrator an application at such time and in such form as the Administrator may require, which such application shall demonstrate how the eligible entity will use the grant in accordance with subsection (a)(3).
In the case of an application from an eligible entity that is a nonprofit organization, the application shall include—

subparagraph.text: a letter of support for the proposed use of the grant from—

clause.text: the relevant local government, territorial government, Tribal government, or State; or

subclause.text: has a demonstrated history of undertaking work in the geographic region where the proposed use of the grant is to take place, as determined by the Administrator; and
would not be involved in the proposed use of the grant; and

subparagraph.text: any other information the Administrator may require.

paragraph.text: In awarding grants under this section, the Administrator shall—

subparagraph.text: seek to award grants for use in diverse locations and for diverse uses; and

clause.text: any eligible entity, excluding any eligible entity that is a nonprofit organization, that—

subclause.text: implements a program to carry out food waste reduction activities; or

has a demonstrated need, as determined by the Administrator, for additional investment in infrastructure or other resources to be able to implement a program to carry out food waste reduction activities; or

clause.text: an eligible entity that will use such grant as provided in subsection (a)(3)(C)(i) in a community of color, low-income community, or Tribal community that has been disproportionately affected by adverse human health or environmental effects.

paragraph.text: With respect to any grant awarded under subsection (a)(3)(C) to carry out an anaerobic digestion project, the Administrator shall—

subparagraph.text: require that the applicant submit a plan for end-product recycling that, in accordance with guidelines the Administrator shall establish—

clause.text: provides for the use of the material resulting from the project as a soil amendment; and
ensures that the use of the material resulting from the project does not create an environmental hazard; and

subparagraph.text: require the eligible entity that is carrying out the project—

clause.text: to limit its use of animal waste to not more than 20 percent of the total feedstock of the project; and
to only use source separated organics as the portion of the total feedstock that is not animal waste.

paragraph.text: Each eligible entity that receives a grant under this section shall submit to the Administrator a report, at such time and in such form as the Administrator may require, on the results of the use of the grant, which such report shall include any relevant data requested by the Administrator for purposes of tracking the effectiveness of the program established under subsection (a)(1).
The Administrator shall submit to Congress and make publicly available on the website of the Environmental Protection Agency an annual report describing—

subparagraph.text: the effectiveness of the program established under subsection (a)(1) at reducing the amount of food waste by 50 percent by 2030, relative to such amount in 2010, including information on the progress of such reduction; and
how the Administrator is promoting learning among grantees and other stakeholders to better achieve results.

subsection.text: There is authorized to be appropriated to carry out this section $650,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2024 through 2033, to remain available until expended.

paragraph.text: The term Administrator means the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency.

subparagraph.text: a State, a local government, a territorial government, or a Tribal government;
a partnership of two or more of any of the entities described in subparagraphs (A) and (B).

paragraph.text: The term food waste means any uneaten food and inedible parts of food.

The term food waste reduction activity means any method or activity that reduces the amount of food waste disposed of in landfills or incinerated, including through prevention, rescue, upcycling, and recycling.

The term nonprofit organization means an organization that is described in section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (26 U.S.C. 501(c)(3)) and is exempt from taxation under section 501(a) of such Code.
The term prevent means to forestall the generation of food waste.
The term recycle means to reuse food waste as a feedstock for a non-food product.
The term rescue means to redirect surplus food for consumption.

subparagraph.text: The term source separated organics means organic waste that is separated from other waste by the waste generator.
The term source separated organics includes materials that are certified to meet ASTM standard D6400 or D6868.
The term source separated organics excludes mixed solid waste.

paragraph.text: The term upcycle means to make new food from ingredients that otherwise would become food waste.
